forumNotes.content:
Boot Multiple Bootable .DMG like ISOs from USB? or CD/DVD  

Boot Multiple Bootable .DMG from USB?  

Is there something like this for the IntelMac/Apple world?   

I have a Multi Boot CD/DVD that allows bootable Tools: Acronis, Partition Magic etc. I'd like to create something like this for my Mac world with certain "Bootable" apps.   
e.g. Super Duper, Disk Warrior, Drive Genius, Volume Works, iDefrag etc etc.   

A simple example of the same is the following article where I can drop ISOs as they are into a USB pen drive thats been prepared to boot a menu which can choose which ISO to boot next.   
It would be great if I can dump all ISOs / DMGs into one USB pen drive / HDD but I'd be okay with making a separate Mac \& PC (Windows \& Linux) Tool kit for booting.   

Boot Multiple ISO from USB (MultiBoot USB  
[http://www.pendrivel...-multiboot-usb/](http://www.pendrivelinux.com/boot-multiple-iso-from-usb-multiboot-usb/ "External link")  

Thoughts? Anyone create / try / look at such Boot tools.

forumNotes.author: Wonko the Sane
forumNotes.content:
The problem is not in the "initial" part of the booting, grub4dos or Syslinux can manage that, the problem is what happens once the booting has been initiated. JFYI: [http://www.boot-land...?showtopic=8944](http://www.boot-land.net/forums/index.php?showtopic=8944 "External link") and: [http://www.boot-land...?showtopic=8131](http://www.boot-land.net/forums/index.php?showtopic=8131 "External link")
grub4dos cannot read HFS, afaik, maybe there is a patched version somwhere, but never happened to see it. ![:D](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/biggrin.png) BUT, check this also: [http://www.boot-land...showtopic=11769](http://www.boot-land.net/forums/index.php?showtopic=11769 "External link") cannot say if it applies. ![:D](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/biggrin.png) ![:D](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/biggrin.png) Wonko
